required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pelvic Area Extension Measurements for Four Types of Lumbopelvic Balance Using Three Different Methods
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison and Reproducibility of Pelvic Area Extension Measurements for Four Types of Lumbopelvic Balance Using Three Different Methods: Clinical Observation Versus Photography Versus the EOS Imaging System

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé
France: Committee for the Protection of Personnes

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of this study is to describe for the first time the expansion reserve of the pelvic area (measurements using the EOS system) for each of the four morphotypes (Roussouly classification) commonly found in a population of healthy volunteers.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional

primary_outcome.measure: EOS measurement of intrinsic reserve extension = angular variation of the sacral slope
EOS measurement of extrinsic extension reserve
primary_outcome.description: = REEeos = angular variation of a specific angle (line joining the center of the sacral plate and the midpoint of the segment involving the center of the femoral head and the line joining this point to the top of the intercondylar knee notch )

primary_outcome.measure: EOS measurement of global extension reserve

secondary_outcome.measure: Goniometric measurement of global extension reserve
Photographic measurement of global extension reserve

secondary_outcome.description: Pelvic Incidence is defined as the angle between two lines: the line perpendicular to the sacral endplate at the middle of the sacral endplate to the line between the middle of the sacral endplate to the middle of the femoral heads.

secondary_outcome.measure: The front acetabular inclination while standing
The sagittal acetabular inclination while standing

arm_group.description: Healthy volunteers 20 to 30 years of age. Intervention: Goniometric measure of pelvic extension reserve. Intervention: Photographic measure of pelvic extension reserve. Intervention: EOS measure of pelvic extension reserve.

intervention.intervention_name: Goniometric measure of pelvic extension reserve.
intervention.description: The pelvic extension reserve (°) is measured via goniometry.

intervention.intervention_name: Photographic measure of pelvic extension reserve.
intervention.description: The pelvic extension reserve (°) is measured using photography.

intervention.intervention_name: EOS measure of pelvic extension reserve.
intervention.description: The pelvic extension reserve (°) is measured using the imaging system EOS.

study_pop.textblock: Healthy volunteers 20 to 30 years of age.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The healthy volunteer must have given his/her informed and signed consent
- The healthy volunteer must be insured or beneficiary of a health insurance plan
Exclusion Criteria:
- The healthy volunteer is participating in another study
- The healthy volunteer is in an exclusion period determined by a previous study
- The healthy volunteer is under judicial protection, under tutorship or curatorship
- The healthy volunteer refuses to sign the consent
- It is impossible to correctly inform the healthy volunteer
- The healthy volunteer is pregnant, parturient, or breastfeeding
- The healthy volunteers had a history of chronic pain or surgery at the hip, the thoracolumbar spine or the sacroiliac area
- The healthy volunteer has a hip, knee or ankle abnormality

facility.name: CHU de Nîmes - Hôpital Universitaire Carémeau
